docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text:
The Company Admin Dashboard gives admins a quick summary of everything happening in their company account. It shows key numbers, shortcuts, and important updates in one place.

When you log in, you will see a welcome message with your name.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_overview_v1.PNG]]

docs.title: Dashboard Summary Cards
docs.text:
1. Total Users: Shows the total number of users created in your company. 2. Employees: Displays how many employees are currently added to the system. 3. Total Reports: Shows the number of spend/claim reports submitted by employees. 4. Pending Approvals: Indicates how many reports are waiting for admin approval. 5. Total Spend This Month: Shows the total company spend recorded for the current month.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_summary_cards_v1.png]]

docs.title: • Analytics
docs.text:
The Analytics section gives company admins a clear view of how the system is being used. It shows important usage metrics, trends, and activity summaries in one place.

You can access it from the main dashboard by clicking the Analytics button.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_analytics_overview_v1.png]]

docs.title: What You Can See in Analytics
docs.text:
1. Number of Users: Shows how many users are currently registered under your company.
  2. Costs/Spends Created: Displays the total number of spending entries added by employees.
  3. **Submitted Reports: ** Shows how many spend reports have been submitted for approval.
  4. Approved Reports: Displays the count of reports that have been reviewed and approved.
  5. Storage Used: Shows how much storage has been used for uploaded receipts and documents.
  6. Monthly Spend: Displays the total amount your company has spent in the current month.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_analytics_1_v1.png]] 1. Reports by Status: This chart shows how many reports fall under each category: - Approved – Reports that have been reviewed and approved - In Approval – Reports currently being checked - Rejected – Reports that were not approved - Submitted – Reports that employees have submitted This helps admins quickly see the overall status of all reports.

2. Monthly Spend Trend: This line graph shows how much your company has spent every month. It helps you understand: - Spending patterns - Months with higher or lower spending - Overall budget trends The graph updates automatically based on submitted reports.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_analytics_2_v1.png]]

3. Storage Growth (GB)

This chart shows how much storage has been used month-by-month.

Storage is used for things like:

  • Uploaded receipts

  • Bills

  • Documents

You can also select the year from the dropdown to view data for different years.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_analytics_3_v1.png]]

docs.title: • Logs
docs.text:
The Activity Logs page shows every action taken by users inside the company account. It helps admins track changes, monitor activity, and maintain transparency.

You can use this page to quickly see who did what and when.

![[nexpense_company_dashboard_logs_1_v1.PNG]]

docs.title: Search & Filters
docs.text:
At the top, you can filter logs using multiple options: • Search Bar: Type any keyword to find specific logs. • Action Types: Filter by actions such as: - Spend Updated - Spend Created - Report Created - User Updated - Login Activity and more.

• Entity Types: Filter based on what was changed: - Spend - Report - User - Department - Company etc. • Users: Select a specific user to see only their activity. • Start Date / End Date: Choose a date range to view logs for a certain period. • Refresh Button: Click to reload the latest activity.

docs.title: Logs Table Overview
docs.text: Each log entry shows: 1. Timestamp: The exact date and time when the action happened. 2. User: The user who performed the action. 3. Event Type: The type of activity performed (e.g., Spend Updated, Report Created, User Updated). 4. Description: A short explanation of what happened. 5. Actions: Click the eye icon to view more details about that log entry.

docs.title: Why Activity Logs are Useful
docs.text:
• Track changes made by employees
  • Monitor suspicious or unexpected actions
  • Verify updates to spends, reports, and user accounts
  • Maintain a transparent audit trail for compliance

docs.title: Approval Matrix
docs.text: The Workflow Builder allows company admins to design a custom approval flow for reports. You can add one or multiple approval levels and decide who approves, when they approve, and under what conditions.

docs.title: Where to Find It
docs.text:
From the left menu, click Configuration → Approval Matrix to open your approval dashboard.

![[nexpense_company_approval_matrix_v1.png]]

docs.title: What You Can Do Here
docs.text:
• Create approval levels (Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, etc.)

  • Choose approval type — such as sequential approvals.

  • Assign approver roles for each level.

  • Add conditions (like amount limits or categories) to trigger specific approval steps.

  • Add more approval steps to build multi-level workflows.

  • Save the entire workflow once all steps are configured.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
This tool helps ensure reports go through the right people before they are finalized, improving control, transparency, and compliance within the company.

![[nexpense_company_approval_matrix_overview.png]]

docs.title: Approval Types
docs.text:
Approvals happen one after another in a fixed order. Each level must approve before the next level starts.

![[nexpense_company_approval_matrix_approver_types.png]]

1. Sequential Approval (One-by-One): In Sequential approval, approvers review the report one after another, in a fixed order.

  • Level 1 approves → then Level 2 → then Level 3

  • The next level starts only after the previous level approves

  • Best for strict workflows and hierarchy-based approvals

Example: Business Head approves → then Accountant approves → then Finance Manager approves

![[nexpense_company_approval_matrix_overview.png]]

2. Parallel Approval (All at the Same Time): In Parallel approval, all assigned approvers get the request at the same time.

  • Approvers act independently, in parallel

  • The report is approved only when all required approvers respond

  • Best for speed, collaboration, or when hierarchy is not required

docs.title: Parallel Approval Requirements
docs.text:
1. Any one approves: The report is approved as soon as any one approver in this level approves it. Faster approval.

  2. Everyone must approve: All approvers in this level must approve the report. Approval moves forward only when everyone agrees.

Example: Business Head, HR, and Finance team all receive the report together.

![[nexpense_company_approval_matrix_parallel.png]]

docs.title: Cost Center
docs.text:
The Cost Centres Management page allows you to create, view, and manage different cost centres in your company. Cost centres help track spending, assign budgets, and organise expenses across departments.

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_v1.png|]]

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_overview_v1.png]]

Each card shows a cost centre with the following details: 1. Name & Code

This is the official name and short code of the cost centre. Example:

  • Human Resources — Code: HR-CC

  • IT Support — Code: ITS-02

2. Description

A short summary of what the cost centre manages. Example:

  • HR manages hiring, payroll, employee support.

  • IT Support handles technical tools and troubleshooting.

3. Budget

The allocated spending limit for that cost centre. Displayed in your selected currency. Example:

  • Budget: ₹4,50,000

4. Status

Shows whether the cost centre is Active or Inactive.

5. Actions (Edit & Delete)

Each cost centre card has two icons:

  • ✏️ Edit – Update details, description, or budget

  • 🗑️ Delete – Remove the cost centre (if no dependency exists)

docs.title: Add Cost Centre
docs.text:
Click “Add Cost Centre” to create a new one.

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_create_1_v1.png]]

You can add:

  • Name

  • Code (optional)

  • Description(optional)

  • Budget (optional)

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_create_2_v1.png]]

docs.title: 🔄 Refresh

docs.title: Projects
docs.text:
The Projects section helps you manage all company projects linked with cost centres. Projects allow you to track spending, assign budgets, and involve specific stakeholders for better control. On the left menu, under Cost Centres, you will see Projects. Clicking on it opens the project management page.

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_projects_v1.png]]

Each project card shows: 1. Project Name & Code: Helps identify the project quickly. 2. Short Description: Explains what the project is about. 3. Project Duration: Shows the start and end dates. 4. Budget: Displays the total budget assigned to the project. 5. Status (Active/Inactive): Tells you whether the project is currently active.

docs.title: Actions You Can Perform
docs.text:
Each project card includes actions:

  • 👥 Stakeholders – View or change assigned users

  • ✏️ Edit – Update project details

  • 🗑 Delete – Remove the project (if not being used)

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_projects_2_v1.png]]

docs.title: Add a New Project
docs.text:
Click the Add Project button on the top-right to create a new project. You can enter the project name, code, cost centre, stakeholders, budget, and description.

![[nexpense_company_cost_center_projects_add_v1 .png]]

  1. Project Name: Enter the main name of the project.
  2. Project Code (Optional): Unique short code for internal reference.
  3. Description (Optional): Explain what this project is about.
  4. Cost Centre: Select the cost centre that will sponsor or manage this project.
  5. Global Project (Optional): Enable this if the project should be visible to all company users. If not selected, you must assign specific stakeholders who can view the project.
  6. Project Stakeholders: Add people responsible for the project or who need access. You can add multiple stakeholders.
  7. Budget (Optional): Project’s total budget.
  8. Start & End Dates (Optional): Set the timeline for the project.
  9. Status: Choose whether the project is Active or Inactive.

docs.title: 1. Key Voucher Statistics
docs.text:
• Total Issued The total value of all vouchers distributed to employees.

  • Remaining The total unused voucher amount left across the company.

  • Returned Vouchers that employees have returned (if any).

docs.title: 2. Voucher Status Summary
docs.text:
• Active – Vouchers that are still valid and can be used.

  • Partially Used – Vouchers that employees have used partially.

  • Exhausted – Vouchers that have been fully used.

  • Returned – Vouchers employees sent back voluntarily or after expiry.

docs.title: 3. User-wise Consumption Table
docs.text:
This section shows voucher usage for each employee:

  • Issued – Total voucher amount given to the employee.

  • Used – Amount the employee has spent.

  • Remaining – Balance left for that employee.

  • Usage % – A visual indicator of how much of their voucher amount has been consumed.

This helps admins quickly identify:

  • Who has fully used their vouchers

  • Who still has balance left

  • Who may need more vouchers

  • Any unusual usage patterns

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
NexPense is a smart and easy-to-use expense management system designed to help employees and companies manage expenses smoothly and accurately.

With NexPense, you can:

  • Record and track your daily expenses

  • Upload receipts easily

  • Create and submit expense reports

  • View approval status in real time

  • Get clear insights into your spending

The platform reduces manual work, avoids errors, and saves time by automating the entire expense process.

docs.title: How AI Extracts Data From Your Receipt
docs.text: When you upload a receipt or invoice, NexPense uses AI-powered OCR (Optical Character Recognition) to automatically read and fill in your expense details.

docs.title: What the AI Extracts Automatically
docs.text:
As soon as you upload a file or take a photo:

  • Invoice Number – Read directly from the document.

  • Invoice Date – Detected from printed dates on the receipt.

  • Amount – Identifies the total amount, currency, and symbols like $, €, ₹, ¥, etc.

  • Vendor / Merchant Name – Extracts the company name printed on the bill.

  • Currency Type – Recognizes if the invoice is in USD, INR, EUR, etc.

  • Category Hints – AI may suggest a category based on the vendor (e.g., food, office, travel).

All extracted fields are shown on the right side under OCR Completed.

docs.title: How Currency Conversion Works
docs.text:
If the receipt is in a foreign currency:

  • AI detects the original currency (e.g., USD).

  • It applies the latest exchange rate automatically.

  • Shows the converted value in your company’s base currency (e.g., INR).

This helps you submit expenses without manually calculating conversions.

docs.text:

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Pending Approvals section allows managers or approvers to review all expenses that require their action.

docs.title: What You Can Do Here
docs.text:
• View all expenses awaiting approval See employee submissions that need your review.

  • Open any expense for detailed review Check receipts, amounts, categories, and other details.

  • Approve, Reject, or Request Changes

    • Approve → Accept the expense and move it forward

    • Reject → Decline the submission with a reason

    • Request Changes → Ask the employee to correct or update information

  • Changes Requested – Items you sent back for updates

This gives you an instant snapshot of your workflow.

  • Date Filter – Filter reports within a specific date range.

docs.text: When you expand a report from the Pending Approvals list, you can view complete details of the submission and take necessary approval actions.

docs.title: 1. Report Header
docs.text:

  • Report Title – Example: Expense Report – January – Shruti

  • Pending As – The role under which you are approving (e.g., CE)

  • Approval Level – Level 1, Level 2, etc.

  • Submitted By – Employee name

  • Total Amount – Total value of the report

  • Expenses Count – Number of attached expenses

  • Date Range – Expense period covered

docs.title: 2. Expense Details
docs.text:
Each expense within the report is listed with:

  • Vendor / Expense Name – Example: Olive JP Nagar

  • Category – Travel, Food, Office, etc.

  • Amount – Value of that individual expense

docs.title: 3. Actions You Can Take
docs.text: At the bottom of the report, you will see three action buttons:

docs.title: ✓ Approve
docs.text: Use this when the report is valid and ready to be approved.

docs.title: ✎ Request Changes
docs.text:
Use this when you need corrections. Example reasons:

  • Missing or unclear receipt

  • Incorrect amount or category

  • Additional explanation required

The employee will receive your request and can resubmit after making updates.

docs.title: ✕ Reject
docs.text: Use this when the report does not comply with company policy or contains invalid expenses (requires a rejection reason).

docs.title: 4. Best Practice
docs.text:
Always open and review each expense using the View button before taking action. This ensures receipts and details are validated before approval.

docs.text: Use the Logout button (at the bottom of the menu) to safely sign out of your NexPense account. This helps protect your data, especially when using shared or public devices.

docs.title: Create Expense Report
docs.text:
Use this option to group your expenses together and submit them as one report. It helps keep everything organized and makes approval faster and easier.

Create a New Report Tap the Create Expense Report button to start grouping your expenses.

![[nexpense_create_report_v1.png|205]]

This screen allows you to set up the basic details of your expense report before adding expenses.

docs.title: 1. Report Name
docs.text:
Enter a name for your report. Example: “Monthly Reports – January”

Choose a name that clearly represents the time period or purpose of the report.

docs.title: 2. Date Range
docs.text:
Select the start and end dates for the expense report:

  • Start Date

  • End Date

These dates define the period for which the expenses belong.

docs.title: 3. Project (Optional)
docs.text:
Choose the project associated with the report. Options may include:

  • No Project

  • Nexpense (NXP)

  • Website Redesign (WRD)

Select a project only if your expenses are tied to that project.

docs.title: 4. Cost Centre (Optional)
docs.text:
Select the department or cost bucket for internal tracking. Options may include:

  • No Cost Centre

  • Infrastructure

  • Office Supplies

This helps your company allocate expenses correctly during accounting.

docs.title: 5. Description / Purpose (Optional)
docs.text:
Add a short explanation about the expense report. Examples:

  • “Monthly expenses for travel and office supplies”

  • “Project-related meeting and transportation costs”

docs.title: 6. Apply Advance Cash (Optional)
docs.text:
If you have received any advance amount from the company, you can apply it here. You will see:

  • Available Amount

  • Total Advance Balance

Whatever amount you enter will be deducted from the final approved total.

docs.title: 7. Save as Draft
docs.text:
Tap “Save Report as Draft” to save your progress. You can return later to edit or add expenses before submitting.

docs.text:

docs.title: 1. Screen Header & Navigation
docs.text:
At the top of the screen, the user sees:

![[nexpense_scan_reciept_header_1_v1.png|605]]

  • Screen Title — Scan Receipt

  • Back Arrow — Navigates to the previous screen

  • Help Icon (?) — Provides guidance or help related to receipt scanning

This header ensures the user clearly understands they are in the receipt capture flow and can exit or seek help at any time.

docs.title: 2. Select Report Section
docs.text:
This section allows the user to decide where the expense should be saved.

![[nexpense_scan_reciept_select_report_v1.jpeg|405]]

  • Report Dropdown — Default option: “Save to Expenses Only (Auto)”

  • Allows quick saving without attaching to a report

This reduces friction for users who want to upload receipts quickly and organize them later.

docs.title: 3. Receipt Upload
docs.text:
![[nexpense_scan_reciept_add_reciept1_v1.png|305]]

![[nexpense_scan_reciept_reciepts_1_v1.jpeg|505]]

docs.text:
![[nexpense_scan_reciept_category_1_v1.png|605]]

docs.text:
At the bottom of the screen, the user can:

![[nexpense_scan_reciept_final_1_v1.png|605]]

  • Rescan — Re-capture the receipt

  • Discard — Cancel the process

docs.text:

docs.title: 1. User Profile
docs.text:

docs.title: a) Theme Style
docs.text: You can choose between two interface styles:

docs.title: • Premium Apps
docs.text:
• Modern rounded UI
  • Soft gradients and clean design
  • Available in Light and Dark modes

docs.title: • Web Consistent
docs.text:
• Matches the look and feel of the web dashboard
  • Ideal for users who work across both platforms
  • Available in Light and Dark modes This allows users to pick a UI style they are most comfortable with.

docs.title: b) Colors & Themes
docs.text:
This section lets users customize the color palette used across the app. - Modify accent colors - Adjust gradients - Personalize the feel of the interface - Works in both theme styles - Ideal for branding or comfort-based customization This feature is especially useful for users who prefer a specific visual aesthetic. #### 1. Theme Style At the top of the Colors & Themes screen, users can select the theme style they want to customize: • Premium App - Soft, rounded modern UI - Gradients and richer color transitions - Light & Dark mode options • Web Consistent - Matches the Nexpense web application's design - Cleaner, sharper UI - Available in Light & Dark modes This selection determines how the chosen colors will be applied across the app.

#### **2. Default Colors**

The app provides a set of pre-designed color presets under Default Colors, grouped into two categories. a) Solid Colors These are single-color options used for: - Buttons - Highlights - Navigation accent - Key UI elements Available solid colors include: - Indigo - Purple - Green - Cyan Users can tap any color to apply it instantly. b) Gradient Colors Gradient colors offer a more visually dynamic experience. Available options include: - Blue gradient - Green gradient - Orange-to-red gradient - Indigo-to-cyan gradient Selecting a gradient theme applies it across supported UI components, giving a premium feel. #### 3. Custom Colors This section allows users to craft their own unique color themes.

![[nexpense_dashboard_overview_settings_preferences_theme_colorsv1.png]]

docs.title: c) Brightness Mode
docs.text: Choose how the app handles brightness: - Light → Always uses light mode - Dark → Always uses dark mode - System → Automatically follows the phone’s system theme This helps users adapt the app to their preferred viewing comfort.

docs.title: d) Default Currency
docs.text: Choose the primary currency used across the app. Examples: - INR (₹) - USD ($) - EUR (€) - GBP (£) The selected currency is applied to: - Expenses - Reports - Approvals - Exported data

docs.title: e) Language
docs.text:
Choose the language used for:

  • Menus

  • Buttons

  • Labels

  • Notifications

The current screenshot shows English, but this field will list all supported languages.

docs.title: 6. Advance Cash
docs.text:
1. Create Advance Request To request advance cash, fill in the following fields: - Amount – Enter the advance amount you need. - Currency – Choose the preferred currency. - Project (Optional) – Select a project if the advance is for specific work. - Cost Centre (Optional) – Link the request to a cost centre if required.

Once completed, tap Create to submit the request.

2. My Advances Below the form, you can view all your previously requested advances. This section will show: - Pending advances - Approved advances - Rejected advances If you haven’t requested any yet, it will display: “No advances yet.”

![[nexpense_dashboard_overview_settings_security_advance_cash_v1.png]]

docs.title: 7. Approvals
docs.text:
• View and manage all expense reports that require your action.

  • Stay informed about items awaiting your approval.

    • Pending Approvals

      • Shows all reports that need to be reviewed and acted upon.

    • Approved by Me

      • Lists all the expense reports you have previously approved.

    • Rejected by Me

      • Displays reports you rejected along with the rejection reasons.

    • Changes Requested

      • Shows reports where you requested modifications from the submitter.

  • Take quick actions on each report.

    • Approve

      • Finalize and accept the submitted expense report.

    • Reject

    • Request Changes
